comments:
Create an FTP Only connection.
Connect with user=anonymous, password=(some e-mail address).
Expand the "My Home" node.
RSE shows "Expand failed. Try again"

The PDE Error log has this stacktrace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.getUserHome(FileServiceSubSystem.java:274)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.servicesubsystem.FileServiceSubSystem.getRemoteFileObject(FileServiceSubSystem.java:195)
at org.eclipse.rse.subsystems.files.core.subsystems.RemoteFileSubSystem.internalResolveFilterString(RemoteFileSubSystem.java:594)


-----------Enter bugs above this line-----------
RSE 1.0 Testing round 2
installation : eclipse-platform-3.2 (M20060629-1905), cdt-3.1.0
RSE install  : debug HEAD of 17-10-2006 from workspace
java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_07-b03
os.name:     : Windows XP 5.1, Service Pack 2
------------------------------------------------
systemtype   : FTP Only
targetuname  : ProFTPD at ftp.ibiblio.org
targetvm     : user: anonymous
------------------------------------------------
Note: expanding below the Root node works ok.

Note: connecting to ftp.ibiblio.org with a commandline ftp client, I see right after connect

ftp> pwd
257 "/" is current directory.

RSE should also use "/" as home directory.

Observed the same problem on ftp.wacom.com, a Windows FTP server:

Verbindung mit ftp.wacom.com wurde hergestellt.

Benutzer (ftp.wacom.com:(none)): anonymous
331 Anonymous access allowed, send identity (e-mail
Kennwort:

ftp> pwd
257 "/" is current directory.
